benchmark_details.name: EngiBench
benchmark_details.overview: EngiBench is a hierarchical benchmark designed to evaluate large language models (LLMs) on solving engineering problems, spanning three levels of increasing difficulty and covering diverse engineering subfields. It facilitates fine-grained analysis of model performance through controlled problem variants.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of EngiBench is to systematically evaluate LLMs on real-world engineering problems across different levels of complexity.

data.source: Data sourced from existing public benchmarks, university educational materials, and modeling competitions.
data.size: 1740 problems across three levels and multiple variants.
data.annotation: Annotated by PhD students and engineering professionals with expert review.

methodology.calculation: Performance is calculated as accuracy for Levels 1 and 2, using binary comparison against reference answers.
methodology.interpretation: Model performance is interpreted based on accuracy and adherence to rubric criteria for open-ended tasks.
methodology.validation: Experimentally validated through scoring against human expert performance.
